      public boolean minToMax()
      The function prompts the user to select whether they want to see a list from minimum to maximum and returns a boolean value indicating the user's choice.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the user wants to see the list from minimum to maximum (true) or not (false).

    • prefixOrSuffix

      public int prefixOrSuffix()
      This function displays a menu for selecting a type of search (prefix, suffix, or exact coincidence) and validates the user's input.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is the option selected by the user for the type of search (prefix, suffix, or exact coincidence).

    • selectProduct

      public int selectProduct()
      This function prompts the user to select a product from a list and validates their input.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is the user's selected product.

    • selectCategory

      public int selectCategory()
      This function prompts the user to select a category type and returns the selected category.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, which is the selected type of category.

    • rangeOrExact

      public boolean rangeOrExact()
      This function prompts the user to choose between a range search and an exact search and returns a boolean value based on the user's choice.
      Returns:
      A boolean value is being returned, which is true if the user selects "Range Search" and false if the user selects "Exact Search".

    • rangeMinAndMax

      public double[] rangeMinAndMax()
      This function prompts the user to enter a range minimum and maximum, ensuring that the maximum is greater than or equal to the minimum, and returns an array containing these values.
      Returns:
      An array of two doubles, where the first element is the range minimum and the second element is the range maximum.

    • rangeMinAndMaxDate

      public Date[] rangeMinAndMaxDate()
      This function prompts the user to enter a range of dates and returns an array containing the minimum and maximum dates.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an array of Date objects, which contains the minimum and maximum dates entered by the user.

    • rangeMinAndMaxString

      public String[] rangeMinAndMaxString(boolean recharge)
      This function prompts the user to enter a range minimum and maximum and returns them as a string array.
      Parameters:
      recharge - A boolean variable that indicates whether the method is being called after a recharge or not. If it is true, it means that the method is being called after a recharge and the user will be prompted to enter the range minimum to search. If it is false, the user will not be prompted to enter
      Returns:
      An array of two strings, where the first string is the range minimum and the second string is the range maximum.

    • validateIntegerOption

      public int validateIntegerOption()
      validateIntegerOption: This method checks if a number is an integer
      Returns:
      option - int: Returns the entered number if it is an integer or returns -1 if it is not an integer
